summary: Creative marketing professional with MBA and extensive leadership experience in sales, marketing, management, and business development across public and private sectors; skilled in international trade, event planning, and strategic initiatives.

experience.title: President
experience.description: Provided contract services to organizations through implementation of global business strategies: identifying new business opportunities, conducting market research, market promotions, trade show representation, and product demonstrations. Negotiated export contracts; managed a Canadian/US Trade Mission for SUSTA, including conferences, guest transportation, media kits, and press releases; served as Master of Ceremony and delivered presentations on international marketing.

experience.title: Director, International Trade Division
experience.description: Supervised maintenance of international trade database and export trade lead program; provided strategic direction, budgetary allocation, training, and staffing for Atlanta and Brussels offices. Organized trade show pavilions, developed seminars on international trade, and linked local suppliers with foreign buyers and distributors. Served on SUSTA allocation committee; oversaw promotional literature, brochures, and press releases; organized trade missions to Canada and Mexico.

experience.title: Assistant Director
experience.description: Supported international trade programs; contributed to program management and promotional activities for international initiatives.

experience.title: International Account Executive
experience.description: Appointed to secure new logistic accounts; computed air and ocean freight rate quotations; increased shipping volume through consolidation; arranged domestic cargo transportation; coordinated shipments; liaison with overseas offices, airlines, and steamship lines; prepared and reviewed international documentation.

experience.title: Cotton/Textile Broker & Sales Manager
experience.description: Increased cotton fiber and textile sales in the Southern U.S. and international markets; expanded domestic and overseas accounts; negotiated lines of credit and letters of credit; directed import/export of agricultural commodities; trained at the International School of Cotton.

experience.title: Supervisor - Risk Fleet Management
experience.description: Supervised a staff of five; coordinated property, casualty, and automobile insurance coverage; negotiated contract renewals and new purchases.

experience.title: Budget Analyst / Legislative Relations
experience.description: Liaison to six large state government agencies; negotiated budgetary requests with facility managers.

education.school: Mercer University, Stetson School of Business and Economics
University of Georgia, Terry College of Business Administration
